messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Newbie /David's schedule
messages.msgSnippet: ... Welcome again, Michelle -- I m David, part of a learning family of two wonderful daughters, wife, dog, lovebird, snakes, and miscellaneous -- I m also the
messages.messageBody:
>
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Some questions from a Newbie
>
> Welcome Michelle,
> I am Amy unschooling mom of 3 girls. We live in MA with my dh Keith, our dog
> and 2 cats. Some books that I can recomend on hsing are: The Homeschooling
> Book of Answers by Linda Dobson; The Big Book of Learning-Getting
> Started-Vol.1 by Mary Pride; And The Skylark Sings With Me by David Albert;
> and anything by Raymond and Dorothy Moore. I hope you find hsing to be what
> you need. It's wonderful!
>

Welcome again, Michelle -- I'm David, part of a learning family of two wonderful
daughters, wife, dog, lovebird, snakes, and miscellaneous -- I'm also the author
of that Skylark book, but don't let that scare you -- we're all working hard at
figuring this out.

Actually, I'm going to disappear from this list for awhile -- we live in
Olympia, Washington, but I'm beginning a homeschooling speaking tour of the east
coast next week, so if that's where you are, come if you again!

Same for everyone else -- here's my schedule:

David AlbertÂ’s East Coast Tour Schedule

September 1-2 - Featured Speaker, Virginia Home Education
Association Conference, Camp Hanover, Mechanicsville,
Virginia (website:
vheafamilyday.homestead.com/VHEAday.html)

September 3 (afternoon) - Homeschool of Hampton Roads,
Old Dominion University, Norfolk, Virginia (website:
Coingo.net/hhr/specialevents.html -- contact Shelley McCoy at
hhr@...)

September 5 (evening) - Reston, Virginia, Reston Eclectic
Homeschoolers, (contact Katie Jay at kj-mj@...)

September 6 (evening) - B'nai Shalom Synagogue, Waterbury,
Connecticut (contact Debbie Humphries at dhumphries@...)

September 8 (4 - 6 p.m.) Tompkins Square Library,
Manhattan, New York, New York City Home Educators Association
(contact sonochuck@... or call 212 677-5131)

September 11 (evening), Garden City, New York, LIGHT
(Long Islanders Growing at Home Together) (contact Devorah
Weinman at Devww2@...)

September 13 (evening), Amherst, Massachusetts, Pathfinder
Learning Center (website: pathfindercenter.org)

September 14 (evening), Cambridge, Massachusetts, First Parish Church
(off Harvard Square), Benefit for Growing Without Schooling/Holt Associates
(www.holtgws.com)

September 16 (all day) - Growing Without Schooling/Holt
Associates/Paths of Learning Magazine
(with Susannah Sheffer, Nancy Plent, and Patrick Farenga,
Monmouth College, Monmouth, New Jersey
(website: www.holtgws.com or call 1-888-925-9298)

September 18 (evening) - Howard County Public
Library-Miller Branch, Ellicott City, Maryland, Howard County Home
Educators (contact Rebeeca Johnson at BWHE-owner@egroups.com)

David

--
"And the Skylark Sings with Me is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's "Common
Sense" was to the American Revolution."-Greg Bates, Common Courage Press. to
read a sample chapter or reviews, or to check out my speaking schedule, visit my
website -- www.skylarksings.com -- or send an e-mail to shantinik@...
